isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - INPUT SHAFT AND MAIN DRIVE GEAR

svcproc.title: INPUT SHAFT AND MAIN DRIVE GEAR

figure.caption: Figure 138. Input Shaft And Main Drive Gear Assembly

step1.para: Use a highly visible toolmaker's dye and mark the main drive gear for timing purposes. To mark the gear, paint the toolmaker's dye on any two adjacent teeth, and then paint the two adjacent teeth directly opposite the first two teeth ( Figure 139).
If necessary, install the bushing in the back of the input shaft.
From inside the case, position and hold the main drive gear in its approximate position.
From the front, slide the input shaft into the main drive gear, and install the snap ring to trap the shaft in the gear ( Figure 140).

note.para: You may notice backlash between the external spline teeth of the input shaft and the internal spline teeth of the main drive gear. The backlash is normal.

figure.caption: Figure 140. Slide Input Shaft into Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Inside the case, mesh the marked tooth on the lower countershaft drive gear with either set of marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 141).

figure.caption: Figure 141. Mesh Marked Tooth With Teeth on Main Drive Gear

step1.para: While holding the main drive gear in the proper position and in time with the lower countershaft, slide the input bearing over the input shaft and start it into its bore. Use a suitable bearing driver to drive it into position until the snap ring bottoms on the case ( Figure 142).

figure.caption: Figure 142. Drive Input Bearing into Position

note.para: The input bearing is not fully installed at this point.

step1.para: Temporarily install the input bearing cover with two or more bolts.
From inside the main case, drive the input shaft forward until it is fully seated.
Remove the input bearing cover, and install the input bearing retaining snap ring.

note.para: Do not replace the small rubber lip seal. It is used only to prevent leakage during shipping.

step1.para: Do not re-install the input bearing cover at this time. Instead, pull the input shaft and bearing forward to allow for mainshaft installation.
